page.title: 06HIGH HURSTWOOD FARMING
page.content: Some former farms are now private homes which have either sold or let land to farmers, but farming, with its related trades is still the only industry here and there are ll farms working some 574 ha, 3 dairy, 7 beef and l mixed. 3 farms also have sheep and in winter look after other farmers sheep moved up from lower and wetter areas. In addition to grass, some corn is grown and a few potatoes. Land values vary from Â£2,500 to Â£4,625 per ha. 3 farms are run as riding or livery stables and the large number of horses kept on farms and privately reflects the popularity of riding as a recreation. There is one large poultry farm with 10,000 layers in battery houses selling eggs direct and to shops in a 25 mile radius. There is also a small unit of rabbits mainly for meat.
